byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and MARK SCOTT

abstract: AT&T's claim that proposed merger with Time Warner will allow combined company to soon offer  fifth-generation wireless technology known as 5G, which will will provide super fast data connection on cellphones, is met with skepticism; many say technology is unlikely to be available until at least next decade because it is expensive to implement, has some inherent limitations and is at center of legal battle between carriers and telecom equipment makers over how it should work.
lead_paragraph: The rapid wireless technology the company has described as a pillar of its Time Warner deal probably is a decade away from meaningful deployment.
snippet: The rapid wireless technology the company has described as a pillar of its Time Warner deal probably is a decade away from meaningful deployment....

headline.main: AT&T’s Vision of Ultrafast Wireless Technology May Be a Mirage
headline.print_headline: AT&T’s Vision for Ultrafast Wireless Technology May Be a Mirage
